newsitem.title: USA: Cincinnati Microwave to file Chapter 11.
newsitem.headline: Cincinnati Microwave to file Chapter 11.

text.p: Cincinnati Microwave Inc. said Thursday it called off its merger agreement with BEL-Tronics USA Inc. and will file for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the "next several days."
Cincinnati Microwave, which makes ultrahigh frequency and microwave wireless communications products, said certain conditions of the merger announced in December were not met.
The conditions included additional working capital being received by Cincinnati Microwave, the company said.
It did not elaborate and company officials were not available to comment.
The Cincinnati-based company also said one of its board members, Joseph O'Donnell, had resigned.
Its stock fell 28.125 cents to 68.75 cents on the Nasdaq market at mid-morning.
